Description: The system shall be capable of accepting user input to define reconfigurable effects for a guitar.
The system shall be capable of emulating multiple effect blocks on a single input signal.
The system's price shall not exceed $300.
The system shall be capable of being carried with a single hand.
The system's mass shall not exceed 3lbs.
The system shall allow users to navigate to the primary features in under a minute.
The system's added total harmonic distortion plus noise shall be less than 0.5%.
The system's latency from input to output shall not exceed 5ms.
The system shall integrate with both the instrument and the output sound system.
The system shall be powered from a 9V power supply.
The system shall provide a materials usage package.
The system shall be capable of performing reliably for over an hour continuously.
The pedal shall provide user interfaces to alter effects in real time.
The pedal shall be capable of accepting new effect configurations from the accompanying software application.
The pedal shall provide multi-effect chain ordering reconfiguration.
The pedal may provide the option to add existing effects pedals to the effects chain.
The pedal's bill of materials shall not exceed $300.
The pedal shall be open source.
The pedal shall not require additional information to assemble than what is provided in the materials usage package.
The pedal shall not exceed a volume of 216in^3.
The pedal's height shall not exceed 4in.
The pedal's mass shall not exceed 3lbs.
The pedal shall allow users to alter effects within 5 seconds from the decision to alter to the change being instantiated.
The pedal shall inform the user of what effects state they are in.
The pedal's input impedance shall be at least 10x the instrument pickups' source resistance to minimize pickup loading.
The pedal's hardware shall not add more than 0.2% to total harmonic distortion plus noise.
The pedal's latency shall not exceed 5ms from input to output.
The pedal shall integrate with the instrument.
The pedal shall integrate with a guitar/bass amplifier.
The pedal may integrate with a PA system.
The pedal may integrate with a computer setup.
The pedal may integrate with a corded headset.
The pedal shall be powered from a 9V power supply.
The pedal shall be capable of processing multiple effects simultaneously.
The pedal shall use anti-aliasing filters will be used to keep aliasing products at least 60-80dB below that of the fundamental.
The pedal shall regulate its internal temperature to ensure all processing units operate at or below 80% of their rated thermal capacity under typical usage conditions.
The impedance-matching network shall result in an input impedance of at least 500kOhms to optimize for the average guitar.
The impedance-matching network may provide an option to result in an input impedance of at least 100kOhms to optimize for the average bass guitar.
The impedance-matching network may provide a muxed solution to switch between guitar and bass guitar optimized networks.
The pedal shall provide a 1/4 inch TS input port.
The DSP board's master clock jitter at the ADC/DAC clock input shall not exceed 100fs RMS.
The DSP board's ADC shall have a total harmonic distortion that does not exceed -90dB.
The DSP board's DAC shall have a total harmonic distortion that does not exceed -90dB.
The DSP board's quantization noise shall not exceed -100dB.
The DSP shall be capable of processing multiple simultaneous effects blocks in parallel without exceeding 60% of its available instruction cycles.
The analog processing network's settling time shall not exceed 1ms.
The analog processing network's clean signal paths shall maintain a frequency response of +/- 5dB from 40Hz to 6kHz.
The analog processing network shall use switches/relays with R_on less than 10Ohms.
Crosstalk in the analog processing network between inactive and active effects shall remain less than -100dB within 40Hz to 6kHz.
The analog processing network shall provide the capability to alter analog effect chain mapping.
The pedal shall provide a 1/4 inch TS output port.
The pedal may provide a USB-MIDI output port.
The pedal may provide a XLR output port.
The pedal may provide a 1/8 inch audio output port.
The pedal may provide a preamp for improved output performance.
USB-MIDI output driver may deliver messages without loss or corruption.
The preamp may drive 1/4 inch TS, XLR, and 1/8 inch outputs.
The control pipeline shall provide the capability to bypass the DSP board.
The control pipeline shall provide the capability to bypass analog effects.
The control pipeline shall accept input from the software application to set effect parameters.
The control pipeline shall accept input from the software application to define effects.
The control pipeline shall accept input from the software application to dictate the chain order of effects.
The control pipeline shall accept inputs from pedal onboard user interfaces to alter parameters.
The control pipeline may accept inputs from pedal onboard user interfaces to alter the chain order of effects.
The control pipeline shall provide a stomp activation/deactivation user interface.
The control pipeline shall provide an indicator for communicating current onboard settings to the user.
The control pipeline may provide a user interface to switch between guitar and bass guitar impedance matching modes.
The control pipeline shall provide the capability to bypass the pre-amp.
The electronics power distribution shall use a 9V power source.
The electronics power distribution shall not require more than 500mA.
The electronics power distribution unit shall provide power to all necessary components during use.
The electronics power distribution shall have central-positive or central-negative polarity.
Power supply ripple and noise shall not exceed 2mV RMS between 40Hz to 6kHz.
The application shall provide deep configurability to digital effects.
The application shall provide basic tuning parameters for effect components.
The application shall provide custom algorithm design tools for designing new effects.
The application shall be capable of outputting configurations to the pedal.
The application shall provide multi-effect chain reordering configuration.
The application may be capable of assigning sets of order configurations to be selected on the pedal.
The application shall be open source.
The application shall not use any third-party software that requires additional monetary investment separate from operating system or other baseline environment requirements.
The application shall allow users to navigate to primary tools and effects presets in under a minute.
The application shall warn, disable with warning, or modify with warning, any effect that would cause total harmonic distortion plus noise to increase by 0.5%.
The application shall provide elementary tutorials on how to design/alter effects.
Digital effects shall provide deep configurability to the user.
Digital effects shall provide multiple levels of abstraction to fit to several user groups.
The digital effect configuration tool shall provide users the option to design their own custom algorithms.
The digital effect configuration tool shall allow all users to navigate to primary tools and effect presets in under a minute.
Digital effects shall provide parameter sets.
The digital effect configuration tool shall allow users to alter digital effect chain path mapping.
The digital effect configuration tool shall provide the capabiliy to alter parameter values.
The analog effect configuration tool shall allow users to alter digital effect chain path mapping.
The analog effect configuration tool shall allow all users to navigate to primary tools and effect presets in under a minute.
The digital effect configuration tool shall provide the capabiliy to alter parameter values.
The efffects validation and upload tool shall warn, disable with warning, or modify with warning, any effect that would cause total harmonic distortion plus noise to increase by 0.3%.
The effects validation and upload tool shall allow users to access validation and upload buttons within 5 seconds.
The effects validation and upload tool shall provide users selectable options for effect warning level.
The effects validation and upload tool shall throw a warning for chain mapping sets that may cause total harmonic distortion plus noise to increase by 0.1% as order of non-linear effects matter.
The effects validation and upload tool shall prevent users from creating chain mapping combinations not provided by the hardware.
The effects validation and upload tool shall be capable of uploading effects and effect chain configurations to the pedal.
Upload to the pedal shall occur upon user upload command.
